page.title: 05A FARM STUDY - GABBER FARM
page.content: Gabber Farm is owned by Mr MacBean and his three sons. They have 122 acres at Gabber and 70 at Langdon, as well as 122 acres elsewhere.He has 8 tractors,1 combine harvester,2 mowers, 2 balers,3 forage harvesters,2 ploughs harrow tillers and rotivators. Hedges are cut by machine.There is a mill for grinding their own corn. There are 450 head of cattle, of which 130 are milk- ers{(3 Friesian}and 1{Hereford bulls). Buildings:- silage tower;pig units;ba- rn;cubicles for cows in the winter; intensive unit for 300{pigs.}Every we- ek 15{pigs}are sold at Totnes. Mrs Ma- cBean rears 300{turkeys}to sell at Ch- ristmas. Each day 300 gallons of milk are sent to Plymouth. Mr MacBean said that farming is a business, and it has to pay;but it can be a dangerous job because of the machines{bulls,}and{bo- {ars.}Hates taking animals to abattoir.
